channel.title: Solved

item.title: Solved
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

it’s not going to work, because if you don’t add a { after the if, it will only do the first thing under it. so even if you don’t have the key, it would still teleport ou the the Y value. Basically, your code would have the same thing as this:

case 10251: // deadportal
{
            if (playerHasItemAmount(991, 1) == true) // 
            {
                 teleportToX = 3681;
             }

            teleportToY = 2973;
            sendMessage("Your key disinigrates as you enter the portal.");
        deleteItem(991, GetItemSlot(991), 1);
else {
            sendMessage("You do not have a DeadMan's Key!");
}
            break;

which won’t compile. Take this code, it will work fine:

case 10251: // deadportal
{
if (playerHasItemAmount(991, 1) == true) // 
{
teleportToX = 3681;
teleportToY = 2973;
sendMessage("Your key disinigrates as you enter the portal.");
deleteItem(991, GetItemSlot(991), 1);
}
else {
sendMessage("You do not have a DeadMan's Key!");
}
}
break;

Read full topic

item.title: Solved
item.dc:creator: @M_A_R_T_Y M A R T Y
item.description:
@M_A_R_T_Y wrote:

Zyle yours was missing a bracket.
I just added another } before the break and it compiled fine. Gonna test it now.

Read full topic

item.title: Solved
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

nope, still not gonna work (you forgot to put { & } after the if statement. so it should look like this:

case 10251: // deadportal
{
            if (playerHasItemAmount(991, 1) == true) // 
            {
            teleportToX = 3681;
            teleportToY = 2973;
            sendMessage("Your key disinigrates as you enter the portal.");
        deleteItem(991, GetItemSlot(991), 1);
} else {
            sendMessage("You do not have a DeadMan's Key!");
}
            break;

Read full topic

item.title: Solved
item.dc:creator: @DomScape DomScape
item.description:
@DomScape wrote:

case 10251: // deadportal { { if (playerHasItemAmount(991, 1) == true) // teleportToX = 3681; teleportToY = 2973; sendMessage("Your key disinigrates as you enter the portal."); deleteItem(991, GetItemSlot(991), 1); } else { sendMessage("You do not have a DeadMan's Key!"); } } break;
try that because u ended the if before the else did its job… so one more bracket to hold it all togeather should work

item.title: Solved
item.dc:creator: @M_A_R_T_Y M A R T Y
item.description:
@M_A_R_T_Y wrote:

I’m making this portal that you need a certain key in your inventory to go through.
I kinda looked at other codes and took copy+pasted other things that looked like they worked.
I came up with this:

case 10251: // deadportal { if (playerHasItemAmount(991, 1) == true) // teleportToX = 3681; teleportToY = 2973; sendMessage("Your key disinigrates as you enter the portal."); deleteItem(991, GetItemSlot(991), 1); } else { sendMessage("You do not have a DeadMan's Key!"); } break;

I get this error though:

client.java:3184: 'else' without 'if' } else { ^ 1 error Files Compiled Successfully! Press any key to continue . . .

Read full topic
